titles: The loyal livery-mens hue and cry after Sir John Presbyter.
Hue and cry after Sir John Presbyter.
publisher: Printed for Robert Miller at the Blew Bible in Bedford Street Covent-Garden,
notes: Verse: "VVIth Hair in Characters, and Luggs in text ..."
First published in 1649 as "The hue and cry after Sir John Presbyter." by John Cleveland.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Presbyterianism --  Controversial literature --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
